creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: variously enamelled with famille rose ladies, children and sages beside pavilions on terraces; borders pierced with H-pattern (has become known as Rockefeller pattern after the late Governor Nelson Rockefeller, who possessed a particularly fine and complete service); .1 man reading, seated on rock formation, woman seated next to him, smaller figure on woman's PL, behind bowl of fruit.
medium: Porcelain with enamel and gilded decoration
text: Similarly decorated and gilded Chinese export porcelain with pierced borders is sometimes called "Rockefeller ware", after the late Gov. Nelson Rockefeller who owned a particularly fine and complete service in this pattern. Each piece has a different scene of courtiers and ladies, many with temples in a palace-like garden. Only a small number of very fine services were ordered between 1795 and 1800, usually by members of the East India Company.
title: Plate
